text: Interesting tweet, says that it was 19 years ago today that the enclosure element was added to RSS, by yours truly, in an effort to add payloads to RSS. I looked it up, and they are right. And through the rest of January 2001, Adam and I were trying out neat hacks that could move large (for the day) audio and video files back and forth between our offices in California and Europe. Here's the piece I wrote that day explaining the idea. The site, twowayweb.com, is gone, but the article is preserved in many places, including archive.org.
